title: Baked fish and chips
description: A guilt-free alternative to deep-fried takeaway

ingredients.details: e.g. cod or halibut, skin on

instructions: Pre-heat oven to 180˚C fan / 160˚C gas mark 4.
Soak potatoes in cold water to remove some of the starch.
Remove all small bones from the fish. Pat the fish dry with kitchen paper and season with salt and pepper.

Place the fish on a large sheet of foil inside a baking tray and cover with the herbs. Fold the foil to make a parcel and pour in the wine. Secure the foil and place in the oven for 15 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Then keep it warm.
Drain the potatoes and dry on kitchen paper. Place them in a single layer on a grill pan under a hot grill. Drizzle with the oil and grill on all sides until golden and cooked.
Serve the fish and chips with the tartare sauce.
imageDesc: A portion of baked fish and chips on a wooden board, with chunky tartare sauce in a small bowl to the side.
